jobDescriptionCopy:
Non-Exempt /Full-time (40 weekly hours)

Reports To: VP of Operations

Collaborates With: All Operations Teams (Packaging, Kitchen, Laboratory, Production and Project Management), Dispensary Operations, Marketing

Job Summary:
The Manufacturing Associate is a position cross-trained to perform daily tasks in all Operations Departments. This role commits to spend the first 6 months training in all Departments.

Responsibilities/Essential Functions:
Ensure high quality, consistent, reliable, compliant and safe manufacturing processes.
Support the manufacturing schedule to ensure product availability.
Packaging: Process flower, preroll and specialty product precisely and according to department guidelines and SOP. Maintain high quality processing and safety standards. Keep accurate and detailed records. Clean and sanitize work tools, equipment and workspace. Label, audit, and organize product for transport. Operate production equipment according to manufacturer instruction. Maintain inventory and perform inspections.
Kitchen: Prepare a variety of products according to established recipes. Keep a consistent and accurate stock of ingredients and supplies. Complete production sheets and other records as required. Package and label finished baked goods. Observe necessary commercial kitchen hygiene. Clean and maintain work areas, utensils and equipment.
Laboratory: Observe Lab Standard Procedures.?Extract cannabis oil to be used for edible production?and maintain quality and yields for oil and distillate production.?Produce a variety of lab products (tinctures, concentrates, beverages, etc). Prepare and submit samples for testing.?Conform to all standard safety requirements. Maintain lab in a safe and clean manner.?Perform routine housekeeping responsibilities (sweep, mop, clean glassware and equipment, surface cleaning). Order?and procure?supplies unique to this operation.?
Production: Prepare and manifest product orders. Print product labels and barcodes. Apply product labels and barcodes, manually and using automated equipment. Assist all departments with product packaging and labeling. Maintain inventory to ensure product availability.
Other duties as assigned

Required Skills and Qualifications:
Acquire and maintain certification in Food Service Safety and Sanitation
Strong attention to detail and quality.
Able to perform basic math and algebraic equations.
Good problem-solving, organizational, analytical and critical thinking skills. Ability to prioritize work and make simple decisions.
Ability to listen, follow directions, communicate and support your team.
Able to use a computer to track inventory, print labels and UPC codes/tags.
Able to perform basic tasks in Outlook, Teams, Word and Excel.
Understanding of regulations and compliance in the cannabis industry.

Preferred Qualifications:
Manufacturing experience

General Housekeeping:
Perform routine housekeeping activities to maintain a safe work space

Computer Preferred Qualifications:
Robust Excel knowledge and experience

Physical and Emotional Requirements:
Must be able to stand for long periods of time, 8 – 10 hours multiple days in a row
Must be able to lift at least 50 lbs.
Ability to work in a confined area.
Must be able to bend/stoop/climb/reach
Must be able to present complex information to groups of people
Must be able to be physically present in the dispensary locations and administrative office
Ability to handle high stress situations, ambiguity and changing priorities
Must be able to tolerate a reasonable amount of work stress

Compensation/Hours:
Compensation - DOE; 40 hours/wk., Required Mon – Fri, some weekends and Holidays, 8:00am to 5:00pm

It is the policy of The Verdes Foundation to provide equal employment (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. In addition, The Verdes Foundation, will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities.

Job Title: Laboratory Manager
Department: Laboratory
Supervisor: Director of Operations
Home Location: Auburndale, FL
FLSA Classification: Exempt

Position Summary:
The Laboratory Manager is responsible for managing the daily operations of the Laboratory department, including ensuring process efficiency, that necessary supplies are stocked, and that talent is allocated appropriately to suit production needs. This person is responsible for meeting production goals by supporting Associates in a high-volume production facility. Furthermore, the Laboratory Manager can identify areas for Continuous Process Improvement and can effectively present action plans to senior leadership.
Essential Functions:

Ensures Associates are meeting daily, weekly, and monthly production goals to meet consumer demand; maintains virtual and physical inventory of product
Manages daily operations of department, including assigning tasks and stations, ensuring process efficiency, that necessary supplies are stocked, and that talent is allocated appropriately to suit production needs
Manages Associates by monitoring attendance, performance, and adherence to company policies and procedures; conducting annual performance evaluations; providing coaching and support; and providing corrective action as needed
Oversees sampling of production batches to be sent for testing and entering results
Completes periodic departmental audits as needed; complies with related recordkeeping requirements including movement logs, production logs, and waste logs
Responsible for maintenance of equipment and machines including ordering parts when needed
Creates and modifies Standard Operating Procedures according to state regulations and production needs
Coordinates with other department managers on a routine basis
Maintains or obtains industry credentials as needed
Training: process, people, & equipment
Safety: ensuring safe work area, update, enforce, train on laboratory safety plan
Creation of new products: quality control, industry standards, testing

Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in the natural sciences (biology, chemistry, plant science, etc.) required
Knowledge of lab safety procedures and protocol
3-5 years of experience as a department manager in a laboratory or production-based environment required
Proficient in Windows 10 operating system, Microsoft Office suite of products, Google Apps for Work and knowledge of MJ Freeway platform
Experience in Lean/Six Sigma work environment a plus
Must feel comfortable working with hydrocarbons or other volatile compounds or substances in a controlled environment, with PPE provided, to extract cannabinoids for product manufacturing
Willing and able to work a flexible schedule with some weekend work and occasional travel
Strong people management skills required
Ability to communicate ideas and resolutions in a clear, concise, friendly manner
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Mechanical aptitude and/or comfortable troubleshooting machines and equipment
Demonstrated ability to effectively multi-task and manage time both independently as well as within a team environment
Continuous Process Improvement mindset
Must be at least 18 years of age
Must have a reliable personal vehicle
Must be able to pass a background check in accordance with state regulations

Physical Requirements:

Ability to sit, stand, and walk as needed
Ability to bend at the waist, kneel, crouch to access equipment
Ability to lift and carry up to 50lbs
Close visual acuity needed for viewing screens and fine print

Workplace Environment

Consistent moderate background noise level due to HVAC and machinery
Exposure to cannabis odor
Exposure to skin contact with plants, to which some individuals may be allergic

Job Type: Full-time

ABOUT YOU

Are you passionate and ready to join an inclusive work environment, committed to leading new ideas and pathways, and to delivering value? If the answer is, “Yes!” then we have an exciting career opportunity for you. Who are we? We are Montrose, a leading environmental services company with 1,600 employees across 70 locations worldwide, focused on supporting clients as they deal with the environmental challenges of today, and prepare for what’s coming tomorrow.

WHAT WE CAN OFFER YOU

Our Mission is: To help protect the air we breathe, the water we drink, and the soil that feeds us, and is supported by our Principles: We Value Our People, We Value Our Community, We Value Our Clients, We Value Our Shareholders. We care for the well-being of our people and offer:

Competitive compensation packages
Industry leading benefits packages including company paid life and disability insurance
Paid parental leave benefits
Progressive vacation policies and company holidays including floating holidays to meet the diverse needs of our people.
401(k) plan offered
A financial assistance program to help support peers in need
An educational reimbursement program
Access to best rates in the industry to bring your student loan debt down to size

A DAY IN THE LIFE

Enthalpy Analytical, is part of the larger organization, Montrose Environmental Group, is comprised of over 9 laboratories servicing air, water, soil, tobacco, cannabis, and toxicity testing. Regulations drive the need for our services, but our unique capabilities allow us to add value to clients beyond environmental compliance.

Our El Dorado Hills, CA facility is currently seeking a Full-Time Data Entry Specialist to join our team.

As a key member of the laboratory team, this role will be responsible for a full range of activities including:

Assisting with data reporting through comparison of multiple data sets
Reviewing each data point for accuracy
Uploading data into Vista’s Laboratory Information Management System (LIMS)
Utilizing LIMS to create sample reports
Working collaboratively with team members to ensure sample data meets all requirements

NECESSARY QUALIFICATIONS

To perform this job successfully, individuals must be able to perform each duty and responsibility satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the duties and responsibilities.

Bachelor's degree or equivalent and relevant formal academic / vocational qualification

PREFERRED SKILLS

Detail oriented
Good knowledge of word processing, spreadsheets, table and graph generation and use of applicable computer software
Effective written and oral communication skills
Good time management and organizational skills
Good editorial and proofreading skills
Good problem solving and troubleshooting abilities
Ability to function both independently and in a team environment
Ability to follow all standard operating procedures
Prior laboratory experience preferred but not required

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature of work being performed by people assigned to this classification. They are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required of employees so classified.

MAKE THE MOVE

From comprehensive air measurement and laboratory services to regulatory compliance, emergency response, permitting, engineering, and remediation, Montrose delivers innovative and practical design, engineering and operational solutions that keep its clients on top of their immediate needs – and well ahead of the strategic curve. We are a fast-paced and dynamic team. At Montrose, you are your own boss, but you will get tons of guidance and plenty of support from talented, super-smart colleagues. Therefore, if freedom, autonomy, head-scratching professional challenges attract you, we’d love to speak with you.

Want to know more about us? Visit montrose-env.com and have fun!

Montrose is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Montrose is committed to providing access and reasonable accommodation in its employment for individuals with disabilities.

Quality Control Description
The Quality Control is responsible for developing, implementing, and managing quality control (QC) systems designed to ensure the continuous production of high-quality products that are consistent with established standards, customer specifications, and production goals. Managers and leads a team of QC personnel responsible for incoming raw materials through finished goods release, as well as the timely generation of batch production records (BPRs).

As a long-term opportunity - When a Quality Control Laboratory is established in Raleigh this individual would lead the team
Quality Assurance Description
Quality Assurance is responsible for guaranteeing the quality of products and services. The work involves careful inspections and the enforcement of quality standards. Other essential duties and responsibilities in quality assurance include ensuring compliance with all good manufacturing procedures, working with key personnel in the facility on quality assurance issues, responsible for ensuring compliance of all regulatory requirements, product quality, micro testing, formula integrity, allergen control program, HACCP, GMP program, hold and release program, and self-inspection program.

Your Impact:
Be responsible for establishing and implementing the necessary programs of facilities personnel including the GMP, HACCP, Allergen, and training programs ensuring they have the required competencies to carry out the functions affecting product legality, safety, and quality.
Conduct audits of vendor/CMO facilities and product ingredients.
Assist in setting quality standards and ensure that CMO production is maintained at such standards
Oversee that FDA, EU, and ISO standard requirements are documented to maintain compliance.
Ensuring that all quality policies and procedures meet national and international standards, devising, improving, and reviewing new specifications and procedures for products or processes, and training staff to use them.
Be responsible for the ingredient specification program, supplier vendor program, regulatory 3rd party audit program, labeling program, pre/post inspection program, verification, and validation program retain sample program and code date adherence program.
Technical experience with HPLC, Gas Chromatograph, and other laboratory equipment. Competences to oversee, perform and sustain analytical method transfers to our various CMOs and 3rd party analytical laboratories as required.
Inspecting the final output, comparing it to the requirements, and approving or rejecting the final products.

Your Experience:
Bachelor’s or master’s degree (preferred) in Chemistry Science, Food Technology, Nutrition, or related field. 8 years’ experience in Quality Assurance/Quality Control in the food or dietary supplement industry. 3 years’ management/supervisory experience.
Proficiency with quality systems and techniques such as statistical process control (SPC), process validation, Corrective and Corrective Actions (CAPAs).
Strong communication, leadership, process development, training, organization, and prioritization skills.
Strong attention to detail, observation, organizational, and leadership skills.
In-depth knowledge of quality control procedures, equipment, and industry standards.
Strong knowledge of mathematics, data analysis, and statistical methods. Good technical and IT skills.
Excellent communication and listening skills.
Liaising closely with other managers and departments in Demetrix and CMOs.

We’ve got you covered:
Our employees are the most important part of what makes our company what it is and we want to provide our team with the best benefits we can. Demetrix offers a variety of benefits to help support our employees and their families outside of work, including:
Health Benefits
Retirement
Flexible Vacation
Food on campus
EAP Resources
Headspace App
Commuter Benefit
Education Allowance Benefit
Voluntary Benefits including Pet Insurance

Some other points:
We welcome applicants of any and all backgrounds with demonstrated abilities in the skills needed to meet our mission. We are always on the lookout for new talent who embrace change and are willing to push the boundaries of what’s possible in life.
Demetrix is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.
Employment with Demetrix is at will. This means your employment is for an indefinite period of time and it is subject to termination by you or Demetrix, with or without cause, with or without notice, and at any time.
The job posting highlights the most critical responsibilities and requirements of the job. It’s not all-inclusive.

Some more about Demetrix:
Nature is a rich source of ingredients. Inconsistent quality and supply, along with inaccessibility of rare substances, mean it’s not always an ideal source to meet the world’s needs.

Demetrix helps customers across the globe produce more for less.

Biotechnology can help by enabling access to more rare and powerful products. With less environmental impact and less cost than traditional methods. Which can lead to more happy, healthy lives.

Demetrix gives you:
Expensive and hard-to-find ingredients at your fingertips, sustainably and affordably
High ingredient purity without residual chemicals or pesticides
Affordable access that is quickly scalable as your business grows
Product consistency and a reliable, global supply
A sustainable solution with a small environmental footprint

Currently, we’re building a product pipeline of cannabinoids, the active compounds in the cannabis plant. Humans have been relying on cannabinoids for health and medicinal purposes for centuries.
Although there are more than 113 unique cannabinoids, very few have been studied. That’s because they are present in such low quantities in the plant. We can produce even the rarest cannabinoids at high purity and volumes. What this will do is enable research for health benefits and, ultimately, provide affordable access to the compounds.

Enthalpy Analytical, is part of the larger organization, Montrose Environmental Group, is comprised of over 9 laboratories servicing air, water, soil, tobacco, cannabis, and toxicity testing. Our Orange, CA facility is currently seeking a Full-Time Laboratory Technician to join our team.

As a key member of the laboratory team, this role will be responsible for a full range of activities including:

Preparation of samples for analysis
Preparation of reagents for lab use and/or shipment
Sample extractions
Determining the volume of samples
Cleaning of laboratory glassware
Maintaining clean laboratory areas

Other duties as assigned by the Group Leader or Lab Director

To perform this job successfully, individuals must be able to perform each duty and responsibility satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. High School diploma or equivalent required

PREFERRED SKILLS

Prior Laboratory experience preferred but not required as this is an entry level position
Knowledge of analytical method, analytical instruments, general lab practices and lab safety
Ability to work independently and in a team

Location: Warren, Michigan
Role: Processing/Lab Manager

A successful company needs passionate employees. Sozo offers competitive compensation, paid time off, employer-subsidized health plans, and opportunities for advancement.

Company Overview:
Sozo Health, Inc. (“Sozo”) is a vertically integrated cannabis company based in Warren, Michigan. Sozo’s operations include all stages from cultivation to sale, both in the medical and adult use markets. Sozo prides itself on producing the consistently highest-quality cannabis, while embracing socially and environmentally responsible practices. In 2022, Sozo expects to expand operations beyond Michigan. Since its formation in 2018, Sozo has supported charitable priorities of education, food security, shelter, and racial justice.

Job Summary:
The Processing/Lab Manager facilitates and supervises the process of concentrate production. The Processing/Lab Manager will manage a small production team, setting a culture of continuous improvement, to achieve production goals set by the Company. The Manager is also responsible for gathering critical data to evaluate each process and present weekly productivity reports to Executives. This position is responsible for the development of standard operating procedures for each machine and station and integrating proprietary processing techniques to maintain a competitive advantage amongst cannabis processors. The role will operate under the direction of the Chief Operating Officer.

Job Responsibilities:

Plan, direct, and organize day-to-day operations to optimize production outputs and meet companywide production and revenue expectations
Ensure the team has all resources needed to complete the tasks for the week/month/quarter
Implement, monitor, and perform calibration of all lab equipment by establishing and ensuring consistent standards of use. Perform preventative maintenance of all equipment as required to ensure the lab is always fully operational
Create, maintain, and update SOPs as they relate to laboratory operations, documenting planned deviations or non-conformities when required
Create accurate cost of goods analysis, production estimates, projected process/cycle times, financial models, budgetary requirements/commitments, staffing/personnel requirements/needs, etc.
Accurately track daily production and usage of raw materials utilized in the final finished product
Reviewing and making calculated decisions based on laboratory results
Oversee third party testing through selected partners.
Review and develop current and future extraction operations to improve efficiency and productivity
Direct and monitor all products are labeled and inputted into METRC as well as internal platforms
Ensure all finished products meet compliance and regulatory requirements as well as internally set quality expectations.
Properly train all staff
Job Requirements:

1+ years’ experience managing teams in a lab setting
2+ years’ experience in cannabis extraction (hydrocarbon, ethanol or solventless)
Experience with data entry and data management
Maintain a high level of integrity, motivation and urgency to complete tasks
Strong written and oral communication skills, organizational, innovative problem-solving, attention to detail, and time management
Familiarity with local, state, and federal laws and regulations pertinent to the operation
Must be and remain compliant with all legal or company regulations for working in the cannabis industry
Ability to use standard office equipment, Microsoft Office applications, computer software, and an in-depth understanding of the METRC tracking system
Minimum of 21 years of age
Possess valid driver’s license or state ID
Must pass all background checks
Sozo is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state or local law.

Sozo is committed to modeling diversity and inclusion for the entire cannabis industry and to maintaining an inclusive environment that provides for equitable treatment for all.

A DAY IN THE LIFE
Enthalpy Analytical, is part of the larger organization, Montrose Environmental Group, is comprised of over 9 laboratories servicing air, water, soil, tobacco, cannabis, and toxicology testing. Regulations drive the need for our services, but our unique capabilities allow us to add value to clients beyond environmental compliance.

Our Richmond, VA laboratory is looking for a Laboratory Technician who will be responsible for performing tasks required to meet the expectations of our clients, in addition to efficiently and profitably generating defensible data in a timely manner. These tasks will be performed under the direction of a Group Leader.

Responsibilities Include:
Preparation of tobacco, cigar(ette), eliquid, or aerosol samples for analysis
Preparation of reagents for lab use and/or shipment
Cleaning of laboratory glassware
Maintaining clean laboratory areas
Maintaining organized records of sample preparation and analysis
Assisting the Group Leaders and analysts in acquiring and inventorying consumables, chemicals, and parts for instrumentation
Comply with Enthalpy’s Quality Assurance Program and other policies
Comply with Enthalpy’s Health and Safety Plan
Other duties as assigned by the Group Leader or Technical Director
Comfortable working with chemicals and glassware
Ability to remain flexible and handle changing priorities
Position requires attention to detail, ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously, and a desire to worth both as part of a team and independently
Comply with Enthalpy’s Quality Assurance Program and other policies
Comply with Enthalpy’s Health and Safety Plan
Other duties as assigned by the Group Leader or Lab Director

NECESSARY QUALIFICATIONS
To perform this job successfully, individuals must be able to perform each duty and responsibility satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the duties and responsibilities.

Associates or Bachelor's degree in Chemistry, Biology, Environmental Science, or related field preferred

Preferred Skills:
Prior Laboratory experience preferred but not required as this is an entry level position
Knowledge of analytical method, analytical instruments, general lab practices and lab safety
Ability to work independently and in a team
Good organizational skills and strong communication skills

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature of work being performed by people assigned to this classification. They are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required of employees so classified.

This position requires employee to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19, unless the employee receives a reasonable accommodation for a valid medical, religious, spiritual exemption. The Company will review requests for a reasonable accommodation for any such exemptions on a case-by-case basis. You are considered "fully vaccinated" at more than two (2) weeks after receiving the second dose in a 2-dose series or more than two (2) weeks after receiving a single dose vaccine.

Our Durham, NC facility is currently seeking a Full-Time Laboratory Technician I in GCMS.

Role and Responsibilities

Cleaning of sampling equipment
Preparation of sampling equipment for prep orders
Preparation of samples for analysis

position: Smithers Cannabis Testing Services Division - Associate Microbiologist
jobDescriptionCopy:
Job Summary

The individual will be responsible for maintenance of microbiology equipment, primarily automated instrumentation as well as other standard and non-standard microbiological instrumentation. The Microbiologist will conduct, troubleshoot and oversee microbiological analysis of cannabis flower, concentrates and infused products as required by state cannabis regulatory body regulations within an ISO 17025 accredited laboratory. The Microbiologist will be responsible for coordinating scheduling with the Laboratory Manager, conducting sample analysis, identifying areas where efficiencies can be implemented into laboratory process workflows, and supporting sales meetings as requested by laboratory management. As time allows, the Microbiologist will also be cross-trained to conduct sample preparation and extraction for subsequent chemical analyses.

The Microbiologist will be responsible for training and oversight of employees working in the microbiology area.

Past job experience or training gained obtaining a master’s degree appropriate to microbiology are preferred. The Microbiologist is expected to have developed an ability to optimize the laboratory workflows to maximize throughput and efficiency while maintaining a high level of quality. Additionally, the individual must be able to represent Smithers to clients both over the phone and in person and transmit a professional image.

A. Job Duties

Essential Functions:
1. Conduct sample analysis in accordance with validated methods and SOPs

2. Ensure timely reporting of results to meet deadlines.

3. Ensure results meet all quality requirements.

4. Analyze microbiology data, and where necessary, troubleshoot unexpected results.

5. Subject matter expert for microbiological analysis.

6. Record and organize data in the Laboratory Information Management System (LIMS) and/or laboratory notebooks

7. Train and oversee employees working in the microbiology function.

8. Maintenance and upkeep of instrumentation.

9. Ensure state regulatory compliance of tests. Advise Smithers on changes to regulatory requirements for microbiological testing of cannabis and cannabis products.

10. Ensure ISO 17025 compliance of relevant studies and processes.

11. Additional duties as assigned, including cross-training to conduct chemical analyses

Good technical writing skills in microbiology [written and oral comprehension, written and oral expression]. Ability to integrate observations (visual and written, discrimina¬tion) into evaluation process. College math [mathematical reasoning, memorizing]. Ability to work at a fast pace without compromising accuracy or completeness, prioritize work assignments and handle stress [high productivity].

Physical Functions

Sitting - 30%

Standing - 70%

Walking - 30%

Writing - 50%

Visual - 100%

B. Chemical Safety

1. Must be able to comprehend the potential hazards of the chemicals in use and adhere to the proper safety techniques as dictated by the Safety Manual and/or Management.

C. Laboratory Safety

1. Must be able to wear gloves, lab coat, eye protection, sleeves, hearing protection, pesticide suit, plastic booties, dust masks, a respirator, and a face mask.

2. Must be able to understand and follow laboratory safety standards.

Job Specifications

B.S. degree in microbiology or related field required, Master’s degree in microbiology or related field preferred, 2-3 years of relevant laboratory experience. Previous experience in a cannabis testing lab is a plus. Proficiency in documentation and procedures required by ISO 17025 preferred.

Next Position Level – Senior Microbiologist

Education
Required
Bachelors or better in Microbiology

ABOUT YOU

Are you passionate and ready to join an inclusive work environment, committed to leading new ideas and pathways, and to delivering value? If the answer is, “Yes!” then we have an exciting career opportunity for you. Who are we? We are Montrose, a leading environmental services company with 1,600 employees across 70 locations worldwide, focused on supporting clients as they deal with the environmental challenges of today, and prepare for what’s coming tomorrow.

WHAT WE CAN OFFER YOU

Our Mission is: To help protect the air we breathe, the water we drink, and the soil that feeds us, and is supported by our Principles: We Value Our People, We Value Our Community, We Value Our Clients, We Value Our Shareholders. We care for the well-being of our people and offer:

Competitive compensation packages
Industry leading benefits packages including company paid life and disability insurance
Paid parental leave benefits
Progressive vacation policies and company holidays including floating holidays to meet the diverse needs of our people.
401(k) plan offered
A financial assistance program to help support peers in need
An educational reimbursement program
Access to best rates in the industry to bring your student loan debt down to size

A DAY IN THE LIFE

Enthalpy Analytical, is part of the larger organization, Montrose Environmental Group, is comprised of over 9 laboratories servicing air, water, soil, tobacco, cannabis, and toxicology testing. Regulations drive the need for our services, but our unique capabilities allow us to add value to clients beyond environmental compliance.

Our El Dorado Hills, CA facility is currently seeking a Full-Time Operation Manager to join our team.

As a key member of the laboratory team, this role will be responsible for a full range of activities including:

The Operations Manager is responsible for the day-to-day operations of the laboratory, ensuring the timely delivery of analytical data reports to clients and the QA department.
The Operations Manager works closely with the Laboratory Director and Technical Director to troubleshoot and solve both technical and procedural issues to ensure efficient processing of client samples through the laboratory.
Coordinate work scheduling and laboratory resource allocation
Supervise and manage adherence to project, SOP/method, and turnaround requirements
Assess production capacity and provide solutions for scheduling, technical, and quality issues
Provide mentorship to staff and ensure they are developing necessary skills and abilities for the work today and in the future
Assist in personnel supervision, time management, and operational efficiency, as well as conflict resolution, personnel skills development and team building
Accurate and timely communication with internal and external clients and occasionally review and sign client reports as needed
May assist in development of analytical methods
Communicate with client’s questions or concerns
Initiate and address non-conformance issues
Overhead projects designed to improve efficiency and/or accuracy of analyses
Comply with Enthalpy’s Quality Assurance Program and other policies
Monitor costs and usage of lab consumables to make informed decisions for purchasing
Ensure staff comply with Enthalpy’s Health and Safety Plan

NECESSARY QUALIFICATIONS

To perform this job successfully, individuals must be able to perform each duty and responsibility satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the duties and responsibilities.

Bachelor's Degree in a physical science or equivalent
Minimum of 4 years laboratory experience
Must have familiarity with environmental sample analysis, chromatography, and mass spectrometry
Must have the ability to manage people effectively

Preferred Skills

Effectiveness-Positive outcomes & results of communication skills
Conflict resolution skills: Removes/Breakdown organizational communication barriers
Assertion Skills-Problem diagnosis, assess corrective action
Ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously and maintain composure during stressful times
Complete documentation and attention to detail

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature of work being performed by people assigned to this classification. They are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required of employees so classified.

MAKE THE MOVE

From comprehensive air measurement and laboratory services to regulatory compliance, emergency response, permitting, engineering, and remediation, Montrose delivers innovative and practical design, engineering and operational solutions that keep its clients on top of their immediate needs – and well ahead of the strategic curve. We are a fast-paced and dynamic team. At Montrose, you are your own boss, but you will get tons of guidance and plenty of support from talented, super-smart colleagues. Therefore, if freedom, autonomy, head-scratching professional challenges attract you, we’d love to speak with you.

Want to know more about us? Visit montrose-env.com and have fun!

Montrose is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Montrose is committed to providing access and reasonable accommodation in its employment for individuals with disabilities.

We are seeking an Animal Research Technician who will assist with experimental protocols in a laboratory focused on behavioral pharmacology and neuroscience research into cannabis, cannabinoids, opioids, alcohol, and nicotine in the Division of Behavioral Biology (faculty supervisors: Elise Weerts, PhD and Cassie Moore, PhD) in the Department of Psychiatry and Behavioral Sciences. The Animal Research Technician will contribute to scientific research projects. There is opportunity for interested individuals for participation in writing and co-authorship of research papers.

Specific Duties & Responsibilities:
Participate as a member of collaborative team in study design and development
Independently carry out daily experimental protocols with rodents, including running behavioral sessions, recording data, and maintaining behavioral equipment (checking, and as necessary, troubleshooting and making repairs/arranging for repairs to be made)
Assist with preparation and administration of experimental drug solutions to laboratory animals
Data entry and management
Maintaining drug accountability records
Providing daily care for laboratory animals
Laboratory maintenance according to USDA and AALAC guidelines
Ordering supplies as needed
Performs miscellaneous related duties as assigned by the PI

Minimum Qualifications (Mandatory):
Bachelor's Degree in a related field such as Biology, Chemistry, Neuroscience.
Additional related experience may substitute for required education, to the extent permitted by the JHU equivalency formula.*


JHU Equivalency Formula: 30 undergraduate degree credits (semester hours) or 18 graduate degree credits may substitute for one year of experience. Additional related experience may substitute for the required education on the same basis. For jobs where equivalency is permitted, up to two years of non-related college course work may be applied towards the total minimum education/experience required for the respective job.
** Applicants who do not meet the posted requirements but are completing their final academic semester/quarter will be considered eligible for employment and may be asked to provide additional information confirming their academic completion date.

Preferred Qualifications:
1- year work experience in veterinary or animal research environment.
Experience with handling laboratory animals, drug injections, behavioral experiments, and aseptic surgery.

Special Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:
Microsoft Office (word, excel).
Excellent organization skills, conscientious in following directions, attentive to details.
Must be reliable in attendance, able to work well with others.
Must be available to work limited hours on some weekends and holidays.

Physical Requirements:
Able to sit in a normal seated position for extended periods.
Able to reach by extending hand(s) or arm(s) in any direction.
Finger dexterity required, able to manipulate objects with fingers rather than entire hand(s) or arm(s), e.g., use of computer keyboard.
Communication skills using the spoken word.
Ability to see within normal parameters.
Ability to hear within normal range.
Ability to lift weights up to 30 lbs.

Columbia Laboratories is looking for a Laboratory Technician to join our growing team. We are a long standing, accredited food safety, cannabis/hemp, and water testing laboratory in Portland, OR. Columbia Labs is a proud member of the Tentamus Group, a global team of laboratories focused on human wellness.

Primary Responsibilities:

Work with the supervisor to determine priority of samples, including;
Standard preparation
Sample extraction
Instrument setup
Data entry
Properly handle and dispose of laboratory hazardous waste.
Seek opportunities to reduce routine laboratory costs by increased efficiency (higher throughput, decreased cost of supplies).
Execute projects as assigned to meet changing laboratory needs and requirements.
Shared responsibility for general laboratory organization and cleanliness.
Communication of relevant work details to Lab Supervisor and coworkers.
Other duties as assigned.

Basic Qualifications:

Strong computer, scientific, and organizational skills
Excellent communication (oral & written) and attention to detail
Ability to work independently and as part of a team, self-motivation, adaptability, and a positive attitude

Able to stand for long periods of time and regularly lift 20 pounds.

Education and Experience:

High School Graduate or GED with preference for candidates with experience working in a production laboratory.
Good knowledge of Environmental laboratory terminology, wet chemistry, bench work, equipment, materials, and the techniques/procedures commonly used in a production laboratory.
Knowledge of LIMS, Microsoft Word, Excel, and Outlook.
Familiarity with EPA methodologies, regulations, and environmental data compliance.
Authorization to work in the United States indefinitely without restriction or sponsorship.
Position is full-time with overtime as needed. Day Shift Monday-Friday.

Tentamus Group is a global product and safety firm with a core presence in Europe, Israel, China, Japan, and North America. Tentamus evaluates and consults on products involving the human body with strong focus on food, nutraceuticals, and cosmetics. Tentamus is represented in over 80 locations worldwide with more than 3,500 highly trained staff members.

Job Title: Lab Technician

Reports To: Processing Manager

Department: Processing

FLSA Status: Non-Exempt

Supervisory Responsibility: NA

Position Summary:
The Lab Tech will execute a variety of laboratory and manufacturing tasks under the direction and supervision of our Lab Director. The Lab Technician will be responsible for assisting in product processing and formulation. The Lab Technician completes tasks assigned by the Lab Manager to operate lab equipment, monitor and maintain cleanliness and efficiency, and drives quality control while always being compliant. This individual must be able to multitask, work quickly and efficiently, and be adaptable to changing priorities and tasks as needed.

Furthermore, the successful candidate will be expected to interact with managers and supervisors to set manufacturing schedules and ensure proper execution of workflow tasks by other employees. We have a very fast- paced environment as we continue to grow and expand. The individual must be motivated, trustworthy, and able to operate both independently and within a team environment.

Essential Functions:
Operate laboratory, extraction, and manufacturing equipment
Follow all company policies and procedures to ensure product integrity and quality control
Assist with testing and calibrating lab equipment in preparation for specific tasks
Perform quality control tests on ingredients, completed products, and product samples
Work closely with logistics team to deliver the highest quality products, on-time, accurately, and compliantly
Maintain accurate inventory of all products
Provide feedback to Lab Director and fellow team members in support of our continuous improvement operating priority
Recognize and report any issues, large or small
Perform all tasks as directed by the Lab Director

Manufacturing

Responsible for the preparation and execution of Cure s extraction and processing of product in accordance with the company s Standard Operating Procedures
Ensures consistency and efficacy of product through close attention to detail
Perform lab bench work and product filtrations
Assist in packaging department as needed
Create distilled, high purity concentrate medical marijuana for use in a variety of products including vape, edibles, topicals, and tinctures
Execute the preparation and production of extracted products
Execute proper labeling and storage of extracted products
Complete all orders for extracted products in an efficient and timely manner, meeting all necessary deadlines
Coordinate equipment maintenance, purchases, and repairs with the Lab Director as needed
Execute and enforce compliance of all local and state regulations
Follow weekly schedules to ensure there is proper coverage based on the business needs

Facility Cleaning

Perform all assigned duties required to ensure a clean and safe production facility
Ensure personal hygiene is acceptable under standards set by Cure before performing any production activities by washing hands, wearing a hair net, changing clothes
Complete the sanitation of all production equipment and tools including workspace, lab equipment, containers, and appliances.
Monitor, clean, and maintain all equipment and operate all equipment safely in its intended manner
Ensure compliance at all times with all sanitation regulations and safety standards in the production of all products
Perform duties as needed outlined in the daily, weekly, and monthly cleaning schedules

Requirements

Past experience in a highly regulated field producing pharmaceutical or nutraceutical products preferred
Effective time-management skills and ability to multi-task
Ability to work in a fast-paced, changing and challenging environment
Proficiency in windows-based software and Metrc experience a plus

Competencies:
Technically focused
Integrity and trust
Attention to detail
Approachability
Communication skills

Working Conditions:
While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to perform grasping, talking, hearing, seeing and other repetitive motions.

The employee is frequently is required to stand for long periods of time, use hands for detailed work.

Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and ability to adjust focus. This position requires the ability to occasionally lift products and supplies, up to 75 pounds (or more with assistance). Strong odors and varying room temperatures will occur on a daily basis. This position setting is in a general Lab setting.

Position Type/Expected Hours of Work

This is a full-time position, and hours of work and days will vary due to business needs. Some holidays and overtime maybe required.

Travel

None.

EEO

Our organization does not discriminate against our employees or applicants because of race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, national origin, ancestry, age, marital status, sexual orientation, veteran status, physical or mental disability, medical condition, or any other status or classification protected by applicable federal, state, and/or local laws. Equal employment opportunity will be extended to all persons in all aspects of the employer-associate relationships, including recruitment, hiring, advancement, compensation, benefits, training, promotion, transfer, discipline, layoff, recall and termination. Every reasonable accommodation will be made for qualified disabled employees/applicants.

Other Duties

Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

Submits data reports and Certificates of Analysis (COA) for approval

Job Summary

The Microbial Analyst, working within a team of industry professionals, will be responsible for assisting in the day to day upkeep and support of the laboratory by cleaning the lab and laboratory equipment; data entry; assisting with batch homogenization and sampling; restocking and verifying laboratory supply inventory; disposing of completed sample materials; and sample batch preparation and analysis. Primary focus is the testing of bacteria (Aerobic, Bile-Tolerant Gram-Negative Bacteria, Coliforms, Salmonella, STECs, mycotoxins, and other biological organisms to ensure that all medical cannabis samples are safe.
Role and Responsibilities

· Interpret and evaluate data in terms of accuracy, precision, trends, and potential GMP impact and recommend appropriate corrective action where necessary.

· High productivity and the ability to multi-task coupled with a low error rate and attention to detail are critical characteristics of this position.

· Demonstrates flexibility/agility and engagement in a changing environment. Expected to display good laboratory technique to avoid cross contamination or misidentification of samples.

· Able to comprehend and perform both routine and non-routine analyses from compendial and internal sources.

· Functional applications of the Quality Control Management System Application to include addressment of data review, out of specification reporting and Correction/Preventative actions.

· Conduct in house Instrument Maintenance as needed and monitoring of Consumable Inventory.

· Successfully complete proficiency testing and initial demonstration of competency as required.

· Participate in method revisions and deviations as needed.

· Train others employees should incumbent be primary subject matter expert on particular skill sets and knowledge.

· Execute assigned workload on a daily basis in coordination with management and team; members to effectively schedule multiple assignments;

· Contribute to a cohesive team environment;

· Meet project and service deadlines in collaboration with colleagues;

· Prepare samples for analysis; and

· Other Duties as assigned. These duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.
Qualifications and Education Requirements

Ability to understand and scientifically interpret data utilizing analytical skills and practical

experience.

Ability to interface and communicate effectively with a variety of levels of personnel from bench

level to upper management levels.

Ability to manage multiple, changing priorities while maintaining department efficiencies.
Ability to maintain confidentiality of frequently sensitive information.
Ability to clean, disinfect, and sterilize is preferred.
Bachelor’s degree in a physical or life science with a minimum of two years of experience in an analytical laboratory or Four years of experience in an analytical laboratory.
Education and experience in Microbiology or equivalent preferred.

Preferred Skills

Experience with analytical techniques and instrumentation including, but not limited to: qPCR, PCR/ Thermal-Cycler, Micro-Array, LCMS, & Standard Culture and Count.
Experience working in an ISO/IEC 17025 Accredited Laboratory or similar.

Core operational hours of the laboratory will be from 9:00 a.m.- 3:00 p.m. Monday through Friday(excluding holidays).

We play an integral role in food and product safety for industry-leading producers, as well as family run operations much like our own. Our location in Lincolnwood, LI is currently looking to hire a full-time Chemistry Technician (40 hours/week and benefits included). We offer a competitive salary based upon knowledge and experience. Job Type: Full-time

Company Description

Since our founding in 2009, Rm3 Labs has been a leader in providing scientific analysis for the cannabis community of Colorado. As a fully independent, analytical laboratory located in Broomfield, we bring state-of-the-art scientific expertise and technology to help our clients produce safe, pure, and effective cannabis products. We are ISO/IEC 17025 accredited and licensed and certified by the State.

Job Summary

We are looking for a full-time Courier and Accessioning Technician to plan routes, pick up samples from client facilities in the Denver metro area, Fort Collins/Boulder, and/or Colorado Springs/Pueblo, accession samples in-house, and provide excellent customer service.

This position will require driving in a personal vehicle (mileage reimbursement paid when using personal vehicle) or the company car, if available. It is estimated that a personal vehicle will need to be used for 150 - 200 miles per week. After courier routes, the rest of the workday will be spent in the lab accessioning samples into our system.

The schedule for this position is Mondays through Fridays from 8:30am - 5pm, unless assigned the south route, in which case the scheduled hours will be from 5:30am - 2pm.

Benefits include three weeks of paid time off, six paid holidays, maternity/paternity leave, subsidized healthcare and dental insurance, holiday bonus based on performance, and professional development assistance.

Responsibilities

Maintain Rm3 Labs’ brand essence when communicating with clients and lab visitors by demonstrating professional, courteous and cooperative behavior.
Maintain general knowledge on Rm3 Labs’ services, METRC, and current testing and sampling rules.
Comply with State, Local, OSHA, and ISO 17025 requirements.
Plan and follow the most efficient routes for picking up samples and drive safely to client facilities to pick up samples.
Receive samples from client facilities and accession samples into our system in-house.
Check samples for accuracy, tampering and/or possible adulteration and ensure all pertinent information is documented.
Label samples with the internal Rm3 Labs ID and test analyses required and deliver samples to the appropriate department inbox.
Other administrative tasks, as assigned.
Report concerns or manifest questions to the Accessioning Lead or Client Service Lead.

Requirements

Must pass an extensive background check with no felony convictions and obtain a Colorado Department of Revenue – Marijuana Enforcement Division (DOR-MED) employee license prior to or at the time of hire.
Excellent driving record and a reliable vehicle.
Experience in customer service, data entry, and/or similar high-volume, detailed work.
Able to work independently and part of a team in a fast-paced environment.
Able to interact professionally with colleagues and bring up concerns immediately when you are faced with them.
Good written and verbal communication skills.
Detail and accuracy oriented.

The Ideal Candidate

Enjoys driving.
Thrives in a fast-paced, professional, and fun work environment.
Is self-motivated and focused on continual improvement.
Has a passion for the cannabis industry.
Cannabis industry experience and/or METRC experience is a strong plus.
Having a current MED employee badge is a strong plus.
Computer skills and experience in Windows and Microsoft Office is a plus.

Description:
ABOUT US:
Sonoma Lab Works is a state-of-the-art licensed laboratory facility in Santa Rosa, California. We engage in testing of cannabis and hemp products for both compliance and research & development purposes.

We work in a highly regulated industry that requires close adherence to rules & regulations set forth by the state. We are an equal opportunity employer who is dedicated to providing a safe, professional, and productive work environment for our team members.

WHO YOU ARE:
You have an interest and experience in lab science and are comfortable working in a fast-paced laboratory environment. You are flexible, communicate well, are quick to learn and follow procedures, and enjoy interacting with a team.

DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES

Follows established high-complexity analysis methods and procedures
Works closely with lab technicians to ensure samples are analyzed shortly after preparation
Follows sample progress with LIMS/record keeping
Ensures all data is transferred accurately to LIMS and identifies any data errors
Assists with Quality Assurance
Prepares samples for high complexity testing, including routine sample preparation and breaking down samples
Participates in monitoring levels of inventory and preventing stock-outs
Assures proper calibration and function of laboratory equipment, including routine and preventative maintenance
Assists in the upkeep of cleanliness in the laboratory, including workspace organization, disposal of waste, and cleaning of glassware
Assists in training and onboarding of new Lab Technicians
Assists in daily prioritization of samples depending on rush status

ADDITIONAL DETAILS

Position is full-time hourly with opportunities for overtime
As a small business, all employees are expected to assist in cross-department duties as needed
Competitive benefits package includes paid vacation, holidays and sick time, company-paid health insurance, and company-matched 401(k) plan

Sonoma Lab Works is an Equal Opportunity Employer

. Requirements:
REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS & EXPERIENCE

Must be minimum 21 years old
Bachelor’s degree in chemistry or related field of study or minimum 2 years of experience using the below instrumentation types
Proficiency with one or more of the following instrumentation types: HPLC, GC, GC-MS, GC-MS/MS, ICP-MS, LC-MS/MS
Knowledge of sample preparation techniques
Must be proficient with computer and mobile phone applications
Must be able to lift/move items up to 35 lbs
Must be able to stand/sit for extended periods of time

DESIRED ATTRIBUTES

Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, high-volume environment with an emphasis on accuracy and timeliness
Self-motivation, accountability, adaptability, and a positive attitude
Initiative to ask questions to overcome obstacles and find solutions
Remaining composed and calm under pressure
Ability to laugh and have a good time without losing your focus while working really hard
Excellent written and verbal communications skills
Ability to work independently and as part of a team
Producing quality work under tight deadlines

Company Overview:

Kaycha Labs is a leading provider of innovative Cannabis and Hemp testing technologies and methods. We perform product testing to help ensure compliance with state and federal regulations. We provide comprehensive cannabis testing for potency, homogeneity, heavy metals, microbial contamination, mycotoxins, residual solvents, terpenes, and pesticides.

Essential Functions:

The physical demands described here are representative of those that an employee must meet to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

While performing the duties of this job the employee is frequently required to stand, handle or feel, to speak, and to hear. The employee is occasionally required to walk, sit, reach with hands and arms, bend, kneel, crouch, or crawl. The employee must frequently lift and/or move up to thirty-five (35) pounds.

Specific vision abilities required for this job include close (proximity) vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus.

Work Environment:

The work environment described here is representative of that which an employee may encounter while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

The standard analytical laboratory environment is one in which potential health hazards do exist. Administrative, operations, technical, and professional staff are expected to safely operate in accordance with applicable and appropriate health and safety policies and procedures, as prescribed by the applicable Kaycha manuals and policies and/or federal, state, or local standards.

Laboratory staff can be expected to work in areas where hazards associated are with, but not limited to, airborne pathogens. Biological materials, hazardous substances, and radioactive material exist and are handled. Appropriate training is provided regarding these hazards and staff are expected to adhere to all health and safety policies at all times, whether they are in writing or verbalized by a supervisor.
